author: Amazon Customer

review: I love my Chromecast.  It's an easy way to watch Netflix on my TV, but that's only because my plasma pre-dates smart TVs.  The support for other streaming apps out there isn't wide enough yet.  And streaming from a Chrome browser tab is video-only.  The audio still comes from the source device speakers (PC, phone, etc). This is okay if you want to gather everyone around to look at a web page together, but useless if you want to stream video from un-supported apps onto the TV.This is a fantastic gift for people who need an easy way to watch Netflix on a non-smart TV.  Bought one for my in-laws for Christmas and they love it, but that's all they use it for.

review: An Amazon help line person told me that if I got the Kindle HDX, I should get the Google Chromecast so I could play my Kindle content on my HD TV.  I could not get this to work.  If I got a Netflix or the Hula app it would work, but I wanted to play the Prime account movies and Rhapsody music on my TV (and this my stereo system).  MAyday said it would not work and they had no alternatives after 12/25/13.  I returned this thing.  Thankfully AMazon made it easy to return.  SInce then the Netgear Push2TV was brought to my attention as supporting the Kindle HDX.  It worked like a charm.
